Wind-UI Documentation

Build lightweight and customizable UI components with ease.

Introduction

Welcome to Wind-UI, your one-stop solution for building modern, lightweight UI components with minimal effort. This library focuses on simplicity, scalability, and performance, allowing you to add themes and UI elements to your projects quickly.

Quick Start

Getting started with Wind-UI is super easy. Simply include the CSS file in your project via our CDN: 

<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://ui.drasticcoder.in/neobrutalism.css">

Or, if you prefer, you can load it dynamically using our JS loader: 

<script src="https://ui.drasticcoder.in/cdn.js"></script>

How It Works

The CSS classes provided by Wind-UI are pre-designed to support various modern design systems. Here's a brief breakdown:

  • Utility Classes: Use pre-built utility classes for common tasks like padding, margin, and text alignment.
  • Themes: Currently, the Neobrutalism theme is supported. More themes (e.g., Glassmorphism, Minimalism) are coming soon.
  • Customizable: Use your own custom values with square-bracket syntax (e.g., bg-[#ababab]).

Examples

Here's an example of how to use Wind-UI to create a card:

<div class="card bg-primary p-4 text-center">
  <h2>Welcome to Wind-UI</h2>
  <p>Fast, lightweight, and customizable.</p>
</div>

The above code generates a card with a primary background, padding, and centered text. More components like modals, toasts, and forms are coming soon.
